children.name: memory
children.definition: someone’s ability to remember things, places, experiences etc: trí nhớ

children.name: good/excellent
examples: I wish my memory was as good as yours.

children.name: bad/poor/terrible
examples: A student with a poor memory may struggle in school.

children.name: short-term memory
children.definition: your ability to remember things that you have just seen, heard, or done
examples: The drug can damage your short-term memory.

children.name: long-term memory
children.definition: your ability to remember things that happened a long time ago
examples: Most people's long-term memory is limited.

children.name: visual memory
children.definition: your ability to remember things you have seen
examples: Poor spellers often have a weak visual memory.

children.name: a photographic memory
children.definition: the ability to remember every detail of things that you have seen
examples: Unless you have a photographic memory, you forget half of what you read as soon as you close the book.

children.name: remain/stay/stick in your memory
children.definition: be remembered for a long time
examples: That day will remain in my memory forever.

children.name: refresh/jog your memory
children.definition: help someone to remember something
examples: Perhaps this photograph will refresh your memory?

children.name: lose your memory
children.definition: become unable to remember things that happened in the past
examples: The blow on the head caused him to lose his memory.

children.name: commit something to memoryformal
children.definition: make yourself remember something
examples: I've already committed his name to memory.

children.name: have a short memory
children.definition: if you have a short memory, you soon forget things
examples: Voters have short memories.

children.name: have a long memory
children.definition: if you have a long memory, you remember things for a long time
examples: He has a long memory for people who have let him down.

children.name: have a memory like a sieve
children.definition: forget things very easily
examples: I'm sorry, I have a memory like a sieve. I forgot you were coming today!

children.name: loss of memory/memory loss
children.definition: when you cannot remember things
examples: The condition can cause dizziness and memory loss.

children.name: a lapse of memory/a memory lapse
children.definition: when you cannot remember something for a short time
examples: The alcohol seemed to make him suffer lapses of memory.

children.name: if my memory serves
children.definition: me correctly/right
examples: (= used to say that you are almost certain you have remembered something correctly )If my memory serves me correctly, Johnson was also there.

children.name: sth is etched in your memory
children.definition: it is impossible to forget
examples: The date was etched in my memory.

children.name: memory for
examples: She has a terrible memory for names.

children.name: do sth from memory
examples: These stories were told and retold, mainly from memory.
The pianist played the whole piece from memory.

children.name: in your memory
examples: The image has remained in my memory ever since.

children.name: recall
children.definition: the ability to take information from your memory in order to use it:
examples: khả năng hồi tưởng
▪ Even in old age, his powers of recall were astonishing.
▪ In advanced cases of the disease, there is a very rapid loss of recall and a decay of memory.
total recall :khả năng hồi tưởng lại toàn bộ
the ability to remember everything you want to remember
▪ Dinali has a brilliant mind, with almost total recall of what she has read.

children.name: recollection
children.definition: the abilityto remember things: khả năng ghi nhớ
examples: His powers of recollection are extraordinary.

children.name: sth the you remember from the past
memory
children.definition: sth that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience: ký ức

children.name: good/bad etc memories
examples: He left school with good memories of his time there.

children.name: happy/unhappy memories
examples: Many people have unhappy memories of being forced to play team sports.

children.name: fond memories
children.definition: about someone or something you like
examples: She had fond memories of her aunt and uncle.

children.name: a painful memory
children.definition: very upsetting
examples: He sobbed as he relived the painful memory.

children.name: a vivid memory
children.definition: very clear and detailed
examples: I have vivid memories of that summer.

children.name: a clear memory
examples: I have a clear memory of the first time I met David.

children.name: a dim/distant memory
children.definition: not clear, from a long time ago
examples: He had only dim memories of his father, who had died when he was four.

children.name: a vague memory
children.definition: not clear
examples: I have a vague memory of visiting them when I was small.

children.name: a childhood memory
examples: Going to the farm brought back happy childhood memories.

children.name: somebody's earliest memory
examples: My earliest memory is of being bitten by a dog.

children.name: an abiding/enduring/lasting memory
children.definition: that you will always have
examples: The children's abiding memory of their father is of his patience and gentleness.

children.name: have a/have no memory of sth
children.definition: remember/not remember something
examples: She had no memory of the accident.

children.name: relive a memory
children.definition: talk about past events so you remember them again
examples: Seeing her again was an excuse to relive old memories.

children.name: bring back memories
children.definition: alsorekindle/revive memoriesformal
examples: (= make you remember something )For many older people, the film brought back memories of the war.

children.name: memories come flooding back
children.definition: you suddenly remember things clearly
examples: Evelyn hugged her daughter, as memories came flooding back to her.

children.name: a memory fades
children.definition: becomes less clear and accurate
examples: Write down how you felt before the memory fades.

children.name: a place is full of memories
children.definition: makes you remember things that happened there
examples: My old home is full of unhappy memories.

children.name: be haunted by the memory of something
children.definition: be unable to forget something unhappy
examples: He is haunted by memories of his unhappy childhood.

children.name: shudder/wince at the memory of something
children.definition: be upset by remembering something
examples: She shuddered at the memory of her parents fighting.

children.name: memory of
examples: She talked about her memories of the war.
He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.

children.name: flashback
children.definition: a sudden very clear memory of sth that happened to you in the past:

children.name: have flashbacks of
examples: Eaton stillhas flashbacksof the crash.
I kepthavingflashbacksofher lying there bleeding.

children.name: recollection
children.definition: sth from the past that you remember: ký ức, kỷ niệm

children.name: recollection of
examples: My earliest recollections are of my mother bending over my cot.
I have many pleasant recollectionsofthe time we spent together.

children.name: a dim recollectionsththat you remember slightly, but not very well
examples: I had a dim recollectionofhaving met her before.

children.name: reminiscences
children.definition: a spoken or written story about events that you remember: hồi ký
examples: David became a writer and published his reminiscences many years later.
reminiscence of/about
reminiscences of the war
It was a night of pleasant talk, the two of them exchanging reminiscences about the war.

children.name: nostalgia
children.definition: a feeling that a time in the past was good, or the activity of remembering a good time in the past and wishing that things had not changed: nỗi luyến tiếc quá khứ
examples: nostalgia for
nostalgia for the good old days
He looked back on his university days with a certain amount of nostalgia.
a nostalgic visit to my home town
This song always makes me feel nostalgic.
Seeing those old school photographs has made mefeelquitenostalgic.
anostalgic lookback at the 1950s
nostalgic about
He remained nostalgic about his days as a young actor.

children.name: feel nostalgia
examples: He didn't feel any nostalgia for his school days.

children.name: have nostalgia
examples: The immigrants I spoke to often had an intense nostalgia for their homeland.

children.name: great nostalgia
children.definition: a strong feeling of nostalgia
examples: I read the college newsletter with great nostalgia.

children.name: pure nostalgia
children.definition: used when talking about good things from the past that are not mixed with things from the present
examples: It was an evening of pure nostalgia, as the band played hits from the 1940s.

children.name: a feeling/sense of nostalgia
examples: Did it give you a sense of nostalgia to see the play on Broadway again?

children.name: a pang of nostalgia
children.definition: a short feeling of nostalgia
examples: She felt a pang of nostalgia for the time when they were all children.

children.name: a wave of nostalgia
children.definition: a strong feeling of nostalgia
examples: As I drove into the city I felt a wave of nostalgia sweep over me.

children.name: a nostalgia tripinformal
children.definition: a situation or experience that reminds you of events in the past
examples: Walking around campus was a great nostalgia trip for both of us.

children.name: a nostalgia buffinformal
children.definition: someone who likes old things
examples: The restaurant, which still has its 1930s décor, is a favorite with nostalgia buffs.

children.name: nostalgic[adj]
examples: C2if you feel nostalgic about a time in the past, you feel happy when you remember it, and in some ways you wish that things had not changed :

children.name: recollection
children.definition: an act of remembering sth

children.name: have no recollection (of sth)(= not remember )
examples: I have no recollection of how I found my way there in the dark.

children.name: to (the best of) my recollection(= used when you are unsure if you remember correctly )
examples: To the best of my recollection, she drives a Mercedes.
Noone, to my recollection, gave a second thought to the risks involved.

children.name: a stroll/trip/walk down memory lane
children.definition: when you spend some time remembering the past
examples: She returned to her old school yesterday for a trip down memory lane.

children.name: take a stroll/trip/walk down memory laneto remember happy times in the past
in retrospect
children.definition: thinking back to a time in the past, especially with the advantage of knowing more now than you did then: hồi tưởng, nhìn lại
examples: In retrospect, I wonder if we should have done more.
In retrospect, I think my marriage was doomed from the beginning.
I'm sure my university days seem happier in retrospect than they really were.
